# posthog_role_membership (Resource)

Manages a user's membership in a role within a PostHog organization.

~> **Enterprise Feature:** Role-based access control (RBAC) requires a PostHog Enterprise plan. See [Access Control documentation](https://posthog.com/docs/settings/access-control) for more details.

## Example Usage

```terraform
# First, look up the user by email
data "posthog_user" "alice" {
  organization_id = "your-organization-uuid"
  email           = "alice@example.com"
}

# Create a role
resource "posthog_role" "engineering" {
  organization_id = "your-organization-uuid"
  name            = "Engineering"
}

# Assign Alice to the Engineering role
resource "posthog_role_membership" "alice_engineering" {
  organization_id = "your-organization-uuid"
  role_id         = posthog_role.engineering.id
  user_uuid       = data.posthog_user.alice.uuid
}
```

<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Required

- `role_id` (String) The UUID of the role.
- `user_uuid` (String) The UUID of the user to add to the role.

### Optional

- `organization_id` (String) Organization ID for this resource. Overrides the provider-level organization_id.

### Read-Only

- `id` (String) The UUID of the role membership.
- `joined_at` (String) Timestamp when the user joined the role.
- `user_email` (String) The email address of the user.

## Import

Import is supported using the following syntax:

The [`terraform import` command](https://developer.hashicorp.com/terraform/cli/commands/import) can be used, for example:

```shell
# Import a role membership using the format: organization_id/role_id/membership_id
terraform import posthog_role_membership.alice_engineering your-organization-uuid/your-role-uuid/your-membership-uuid
```
